topicSummary: Vestibular neuronitis (sometimes called vestibular neuritis) is a disorder characterised by acute, isolated, spontaneous, and prolonged vertigo

latestChanges.title: Reviewed
latestChanges.body: A literature search was conducted in August 2017 to identify evidence-based guidelines, UK policy, systematic reviews, and key RCTs published since the last revision of this topic. Minor changes have been made to the sections on diagnosis and symptomatic treatment and a link to patient information has been added. The prescribing information section now includes more detailed information on dosage, contraindications, cautions, adverse effects, and interactions for the recommended drugs.
